snippet: TV will account for 38.4 percent of the $503 billion global ad market this year and will drop to 38 percent of the market in 2016.
abstract: Interpublic Group's Magna Global reports television will account for 38.4 percent of $503 billion global ad market in 2015 and fall to 38 percent in 2016; says digital media will grow 17.2 percent in 2015 to $160 billion, and 13.5 percent in 2016, overtaking TV as biggest ad category by end of 2017.
lead_paragraph: TV will account for 38.4 percent of the $503 billion global ad market this year and will drop to 38 percent of the market in 2016.

headline.main: Digital Ad Spending Expected to Soon Surpass TV
headline.print_headline: Digital Ad Spending Expected to Soon Surpass TV as Biggest Advertising Category
